message.content:
cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of privately learning halfspaces, which is a topic in machine learning (cs.LG). The main building block of the learner is a differentially private algorithm for locating an approximate center point, which is a problem in computational geometry (cs.CG) and data structures (cs.DS). The paper also provides lower bounds on the sample complexity for privately finding a point in the convex hull, which is a problem in computational complexity (cs.CC) and information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper uses techniques from differential privacy (cs.CR).
